job_details.Functieomschrijving:
CrowdStrike is looking for a Sr. Cloud ML Engineer to join the Charlotte AI LLM Ops Engineering Team. Our new colleague will be responsible for building the LLM Ops platform which provides data scientists, software engineers, product managers and other team members with a collaborative environment that facilitates iterative data exploration and annotation for training purposes, as well as experimentation, models evaluation and monitoring of Large Language Models. You are going to develop and maintain the LLM Ops platform which facilitates continuous improvements of CrowdStrike's Charlotte AI assistant product. Prior experience with Golang and LLMs is not required, but will be helpful.

   CrowdStrike is a computer security company, but we do not require candidates for this role to have prior security industry experience. We will mentor and train in security topics as needed. We do expect a strong interest in CrowdStrike's mission and a willingness to engage with the needs of our product teams and customers., * Innovate with Large Language Models to develop and refine Charlotte AI's capabilities.
     * Construct and maintain data pipelines, engage in data upkeep, and contribute to the training and implementation of custom LLMs.
     * Collaborate with teams of Data Scientists, Data Engineering, Product and Cloud Engineering in order to build and evolve the LLM Ops platform for LLM improvements.
     * Improve backend microservices, pinpointing and addressing critical concerns to implement effective solutions.
     * Employ established CrowdStrike tools and services to build cloud solutions for detecting and countering targeted cyber assaults.
     * Collaborate across various teams to brainstorm, define, and devise solutions.
     * Stay attuned to our customers' challenges, always seeking ways to enhance support.
     * Emphasize top-tier coding quality by adhering to best practices, rigorous testing, and thorough logging and metrics.
     * Work within a collaborative and agile team environment.
     * Contribute to mentoring fellow engineers across a spectrum of technologies and also absorb knowledge from them.
     * Constantly explore ways to refine product architecture, knowledge models, user experience, performance, and reliability.
     * Own your work with autonomy, end to end: develop, test, deploy and monitor your changes.
     * Thrive in an environment that highly values trust.

   Technical Stack (comprehensive knowledge is not required; a strong aptitude for continuous learning is vital):
     * AWS (SageMaker, Bedrock)
     * Go (Golang)
     * Python
     * Docker
     * Kubernetes
     * Redis / S3 / EC2 / IAM
     * Kafka
     * GIT
     * Cassandra
     * ElasticSearch
job_details.full_text:
Cloud ML Engineer (Remote)

CrowdStrike is looking for a Sr. Cloud ML Engineer to join the Charlotte AI LLM Ops Engineering Team. Our new colleague will be responsible for building the LLM Ops platform which provides data scientists, software engineers, product managers and other team members with a collaborative environment that facilitates iterative data exploration and annotation for training purposes, as well as experimentation, models evaluation and monitoring of Large Language Models. You are going to develop and maintain the LLM Ops platform which facilitates continuous improvements of CrowdStrike's Charlotte AI assistant product. Prior experience with Golang and LLMs is not required, but will be helpful.

   CrowdStrike is a computer security company, but we do not require candidates for this role to have prior security industry experience. We will mentor and train in security topics as needed. We do expect a strong interest in CrowdStrike's mission and a willingness to engage with the needs of our product teams and customers., * Innovate with Large Language Models to develop and refine Charlotte AI's capabilities.
     * Construct and maintain data pipelines, engage in data upkeep, and contribute to the training and implementation of custom LLMs.
     * Collaborate with teams of Data Scientists, Data Engineering, Product and Cloud Engineering in order to build and evolve the LLM Ops platform for LLM improvements.
     * Improve backend microservices, pinpointing and addressing critical concerns to implement effective solutions.
     * Employ established CrowdStrike tools and services to build cloud solutions for detecting and countering targeted cyber assaults.
     * Collaborate across various teams to brainstorm, define, and devise solutions.
     * Stay attuned to our customers' challenges, always seeking ways to enhance support.
     * Emphasize top-tier coding quality by adhering to best practices, rigorous testing, and thorough logging and metrics.
     * Work within a collaborative and agile team environment.
     * Contribute to mentoring fellow engineers across a spectrum of technologies and also absorb knowledge from them.
     * Constantly explore ways to refine product architecture, knowledge models, user experience, performance, and reliability.
     * Own your work with autonomy, end to end: develop, test, deploy and monitor your changes.
     * Thrive in an environment that highly values trust.

   Technical Stack (comprehensive knowledge is not required; a strong aptitude for continuous learning is vital):
     * AWS (SageMaker, Bedrock)
     * Go (Golang)
     * Python
     * Docker
     * Kubernetes
     * Redis / S3 / EC2 / IAM
     * Kafka
     * GIT
     * Cassandra
     * ElasticSearch

profile_classification.rationale: The role heavily emphasizes building and maintaining an LLM Ops platform, fine-tuning LLMs, and developing applications around them. While it involves cloud engineering and MLOps, the core focus is on generative AI capabilities and integrating them into user-facing systems.

phrases.justification: This phrase indicates an understanding of customer needs and how to improve product offerings, which aligns with aligning technical solutions with business goals.
